meanings.definition: In an angry or enraged manner.
meanings.sent1: She glared irately at her brother for breaking her toy.
meanings.sent2: The customer complained irately about the poor service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed irately when it saw another cat in its territory.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered irately, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The teacher scolded the students irately for not completing their homework.

meanings.definition: Showing or feeling anger or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: His irately expression scared off the other kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: She gave an irately response to the rude comment.
meanings.sent3: The irately squirrel chattered at anyone who came near its tree.
meanings.sent4: The irately red sky warned of the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The irately barking dog kept the neighbors awake all night.
